set.name: Super Best!! Duema Fest Pack: The Rise of Kings MAX Series Volume 1

property.name: Rules
property.value: {SHIELD TRIGGER} (When this tamaseed is put into your hand from your shield zone, you may cast it immediately for no cost.) {SHINKARISE}: You may put evolution creatures on this tamaseed as if it were a creature. ■ When you put this tamaseed, choose one of your opponent's creatures and put it into it's owner's mana zone.

property.name: Set
property.value: Super Best!! Duema Fest Pack: The Rise of Kings MAX Series Volume 1

property.name: Rules
property.value: ■ This creature costs 2 less to summon if you evolve from a tamaseed. {STAR EVOLUTION} Put on one of your RexStars or light creatures. (When this creature would leave, the top card leaves instead.) {DOUBLE BREAKER} ■ Whenever this creature attacks, choose one of the following: ► Choose one of your opponent's creatures or tamaseeds that cost 4 or less. Your opponent's shieldifies that card: ► You may shieldify the top card of your deck.

property.name: Set
property.value: Super Best!! Duema Fest Pack: The Rise of Kings MAX Series Volume 1

property.name: Rules
property.value: {SHINKARISE}: You may put evolution creatures on this tamaseed as if it were a creature. ■ When you put this tamaseed, put a card from your hand on the bottom of your deck, then draw a card.

property.name: Set
property.value: Super Best!! Duema Fest Pack: The Rise of Kings MAX Series Volume 1

property.name: Rules
property.value: {SHIELD TRIGGER} (When this spell is put into your hand from your shield zone, you may cast it immediately for no cost.) ■ Choose up to 2 of your opponent's creatures and return them to their owner's hand. ■ If you have a tamaseed, draw a card.

property.name: Set
property.value: Super Best!! Duema Fest Pack: The Rise of Kings MAX Series Volume 1

property.name: Rules
property.value: {SLAYER} (Whenever this creature battles, destroy the other creature after the battle.) ■ When this creature would be destroyed, you may destroy one of your other creatures or tamaseeds instead.
